trans-unit.source: Encapsulates text layout information (such as alignment, orientation and tab stops) display manipulations (such as ellipsis insertion and national digit substitution) and OpenType features.
This class cannot be inherited.
Many common formats are provided through the <xref:System.Drawing.StringFormatFlags> enumeration.
<xref:System.Drawing.StringFormat> objects can be changed.
Initializes a new <xref href="System.Drawing.StringFormat"></xref> object.
The following table shows initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Drawing.StringFormat> class.
Property
Initial Value
FormatFlags
0 (no flags are set)
Initializes a new <xref href="System.Drawing.StringFormat"></xref> object from the specified existing <xref href="System.Drawing.StringFormat"></xref> object.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.StringFormat"></xref> object from which to initialize the new <xref href="System.Drawing.StringFormat"></xref> object.
format is `null`.
Initializes a new <xref href="System.Drawing.StringFormat"></xref> object with the specified <xref href="System.Drawing.StringFormatFlags"></xref> enumeration.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.StringFormatFlags"></xref> enumeration for the new <xref href="System.Drawing.StringFormat"></xref> object.
Initializes a new <xref href="System.Drawing.StringFormat"></xref> object with the specified <xref href="System.Drawing.StringFormatFlags"></xref> enumeration and language.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.StringFormatFlags"></xref> enumeration for the new <xref href="System.Drawing.StringFormat"></xref> object.
A value that indicates the language of the text.
Gets or sets horizontal alignment of the string.
Use <xref:System.Drawing.StringFormat.LineAlignment%2A> to specify the vertical alignment of the string.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.StringAlignment"></xref> enumeration that specifies the horizontal alignment of the string.
Creates an exact copy of this <xref href="System.Drawing.StringFormat"></xref> object.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.StringFormat"></xref> object this method creates.
Gets the language that is used when local digits are substituted for western digits.
A National Language Support (NLS) language identifier that identifies the language that will be used when local digits are substituted for western digits.
You can pass the <xref href="System.Globalization.CultureInfo.LCID"></xref> property of a <xref href="System.Globalization.CultureInfo"></xref> object as the NLS language identifier.
For example, suppose you create a <xref href="System.Globalization.CultureInfo"></xref> object by passing the string "ar-EG" to a <xref href="System.Globalization.CultureInfo"></xref> constructor.

If you pass the <xref href="System.Globalization.CultureInfo.LCID"></xref> property of that <xref href="System.Globalization.CultureInfo"></xref> object along with <xref href="System.Drawing.StringDigitSubstitute.Traditional"></xref> to the <xref href="System.Drawing.StringFormat.SetDigitSubstitution(System.Int32,System.Drawing.StringDigitSubstitute)"></xref> method, then Arabic-Indic digits will be substituted for western digits at display time.
Gets the method to be used for digit substitution.

A <xref href="System.Drawing.StringDigitSubstitute"></xref> enumeration value that specifies how to substitute characters in a string that cannot be displayed because they are not supported by the current font.
Releases all resources used by this <xref href="System.Drawing.StringFormat"></xref> object.
Calling <xref:System.Drawing.StringFormat.Dispose%2A> allows the resources used by this <xref:System.Drawing.StringFormat> object to be reallocated for other purposes.
Allows an object to try to free resources and perform other cleanup operations before it is reclaimed by garbage collection.
Gets or sets a <xref href="System.Drawing.StringFormatFlags"></xref> enumeration that contains formatting information.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.StringFormatFlags"></xref> enumeration that contains formatting information.
Gets a generic default <xref href="System.Drawing.StringFormat"></xref> object.
The following table shows initial property values for a generic default instance of the <xref:System.Drawing.StringFormat> class.
Property
Initial Value

If you make changes to the <xref:System.Drawing.StringFormat> object returned from the <xref:System.Drawing.StringFormat.GenericDefault%2A> property, these changes persist, and future calls to the <xref:System.Drawing.StringFormat.GenericDefault%2A> property reflects these changes.
The generic default <xref href="System.Drawing.StringFormat"></xref> object.
Gets a generic typographic <xref href="System.Drawing.StringFormat"></xref> object.
The following table shows initial property values for a generic typographic instance of the <xref:System.Drawing.StringFormat> class.
Property
Initial Value
24580 (<xref:System.Drawing.StringFormatFlags.NoClip>, <xref:System.Drawing.StringFormatFlags.FitBlackBox> and <xref:System.Drawing.StringFormatFlags.LineLimit>.)
A generic typographic <xref href="System.Drawing.StringFormat"></xref> object.
Gets the tab stops for this <xref href="System.Drawing.StringFormat"></xref> object.
The number of spaces between the beginning of a text line and the first tab stop.
An array of distances (in number of spaces) between tab stops.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Drawing.Text.HotkeyPrefix"></xref> object for this <xref href="System.Drawing.StringFormat"></xref> object.

In a graphical user interface, a hot key is the underlined letter in a word (usually combined with another key, such as the Alt key) that you can press on the keyboard to activate the functionality that the word represents.

The <xref href="System.Drawing.Text.HotkeyPrefix"></xref> object for this <xref href="System.Drawing.StringFormat"></xref> object, the default is <xref href="System.Drawing.Text.HotkeyPrefix.None"></xref>.
Gets or sets the vertical alignment of the string.
Use <xref:System.Drawing.StringFormat.Alignment%2A> to specify the horizontal alignment of the string.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.StringAlignment"></xref> enumeration that represents the vertical line alignment.
Specifies the language and method to be used when local digits are substituted for western digits.
A National Language Support (NLS) language identifier that identifies the language that will be used when local digits are substituted for western digits.
You can pass the <xref href="System.Globalization.CultureInfo.LCID"></xref> property of a <xref href="System.Globalization.CultureInfo"></xref> object as the NLS language identifier.
For example, suppose you create a <xref href="System.Globalization.CultureInfo"></xref> object by passing the string "ar-EG" to a <xref href="System.Globalization.CultureInfo"></xref> constructor.

If you pass the <xref href="System.Globalization.CultureInfo.LCID"></xref> property of that <xref href="System.Globalization.CultureInfo"></xref> object along with <xref href="System.Drawing.StringDigitSubstitute.Traditional"></xref> to the <xref href="System.Drawing.StringFormat.SetDigitSubstitution(System.Int32,System.Drawing.StringDigitSubstitute)"></xref> method, then Arabic-Indic digits will be substituted for western digits at display time.
An element of the <xref href="System.Drawing.StringDigitSubstitute"></xref> enumeration that specifies how digits are displayed.

Specifies an array of <xref href="System.Drawing.CharacterRange"></xref> structures that represent the ranges of characters measured by a call to the <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics.MeasureCharacterRanges(System.String,System.Drawing.Font,System.Drawing.RectangleF,System.Drawing.StringFormat)"></xref> method.
Setting more than 32 character ranges is not allowed and will cause an <xref:System.OverflowException?displayProperty=fullName>.

An array of <xref href="System.Drawing.CharacterRange"></xref> structures that specifies the ranges of characters measured by a call to the <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics.MeasureCharacterRanges(System.String,System.Drawing.Font,System.Drawing.RectangleF,System.Drawing.StringFormat)"></xref> method.
More than 32 character ranges are set.
Sets tab stops for this <xref href="System.Drawing.StringFormat"></xref> object.
Each tab-stop offset in the `tabStops` array, except the first one, is relative to the previous one.
The first tab-stop offset is relative to the initial offset position specified by `firstTabOffset`.
For example, if the initial offset position is 8 and the first tab-stop offset is 50, then the first tab stop is at position 58.
If the initial offset position is zero, then the first tab-stop offset is relative to position 0, the string origin.
The number of spaces between the beginning of a line of text and the first tab stop.
An array of distances between tab stops in the units specified by the <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics.PageUnit"></xref> property.
Converts this <xref href="System.Drawing.StringFormat"></xref> object to a human-readable string.
Only the value of the <xref:System.Drawing.StringFormat.FormatFlags%2A> property is converted.
A string representation of this <xref href="System.Drawing.StringFormat"></xref> object.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Drawing.StringTrimming"></xref> enumeration for this <xref href="System.Drawing.StringFormat"></xref> object.

A <xref href="System.Drawing.StringTrimming"></xref> enumeration that indicates how text drawn with this <xref href="System.Drawing.StringFormat"></xref> object is trimmed when it exceeds the edges of the layout rectangle.
